sen.j: 吸い物（すいもの）は日本料理のスープの一種で、出汁に醤油や塩を加えて作った汁（吸い地）に椀種、つま、吸い口などを浮かべたもの。
sen.e: Suimono is a kind of soup of Japanese cuisine consisting of suiji (soup stock flavored with soy sauce and salt), wandane (a main, solid ingredient), tsuma (a garnish lending a touch of color), suikuchi (a fragrant garnish) and so forth.

Suimono is a kind of soup of Japanese cuisine consisting of suiji (soup stock flavored with soy sauce and salt), wandane (a main, solid ingredient), tsuma (a garnish lending a touch of color), suikuchi (a fragrant garnish) and so forth.

Suimono is a kind of soup of Japanese cuisine consisting of suiji (soup stock flavored with soy sauce and salt), wandane (a main, solid ingredient), tsuma (a garnish lending a touch of color), suikuchi (a fragrant garnish) and so forth.

sen.j: 漆器の食器に入れて供する。
sen.e: It is served in a lacquer bowl.
sen.cmt: 「漆器の食器」：「漆の椀」と読み替えて訳出しました。
sen.e: It is served in a lacquer bowl.
It is served in a lacquer bowl.

sen.j: すまし汁やおつゆとも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called 'sumashijiru' or 'otsuyu'.
It is also called 'sumashijiru' or 'otsuyu'.
It is also called 'sumashijiru' or 'otsuyu'.

sen.j: 本来、“吸い物”は酒肴であり“汁”は飯とともに供されるものであるが、日常的には混同されることも多い。
sen.e: Originally, "suimono" is an accompaniment to a drink while "shiru" including sumashijiru is served with boiled rice; however, they are often confused with each other.
Originally, "suimono" is an accompaniment to a drink while "shiru" including sumashijiru is served with boiled rice; however, they are often confused with each other.
Originally, "suimono" is an accompaniment to a drink while "shiru" including sumashijiru is served with boiled rice; however, they are often confused with each other.

sen.j: 吸い物は出汁で味が決まるためよい出汁をとることがなによりも重要である。
sen.e: The taste of suimono depends on soup stock; therefore, it is more important than anything else to prepare good soup stock.
The taste of suimono depends on the soup stock; therefore, it is more important than anything else to prepare good soup stock.
The taste of suimono depends on the soup stock; therefore, it is more important than anything else to prepare good soup stock.

sen.j: さっぱりした上品な味付けなので和食の改まった席にも使われる。
sen.e: Having a light, simple taste, suimono is also served on a formal occasion where a Japanese-style meal is served.
Having a light, simple taste, suimono is also served on a formal occasion when a Japanese-style meal is served.
Having a light, simple taste, suimono is also served on a formal occasion when a Japanese-style meal is served.

sen.j: 味付けはやや薄味にすると飲み終わったときに塩辛さを感じない。
sen.e: It does not leave salty aftertaste if cooked with slightly light seasoning,
It does not leave a salty aftertaste if cooked with slightly light seasoning,
It does not leave a salty aftertaste if cooked with slightly light seasoning,

sen.j: 日本ではインスタント食品が数多く出ており、寿司などを配達してもらうとついてくる。
sen.e: In Japan, many kinds of instant suimono are on the market; moreover, suimono accompanies sushi, etc. delivered to order.
In Japan, many kinds of instant suimono are on the market; moreover, suimono accompanies sushi, etc. delivered to order.
In Japan, many kinds of instant suimono are on the market; moreover, suimono accompanies sushi, etc. delivered to order.

sen.j: 吸い物においてその中心となる実を椀種という。
sen.e: A main, solid ingredient of suimono is called wandane.
A main, solid ingredient of suimono is called wandane.
A main, solid ingredient of suimono is called wandane.

sen.j: 魚介類や鶏肉など、生の動物質を使うときは、必ず一度茹でて水溶性たんぱく質を凝固させ、溶出を防止しないと汁が濁り、見た目が悪くなる。
sen.e: When using raw animal food such as fish, shellfish and chicken, it is necessary to boil it without fail to solidify water-soluble protein and thereby to prevent it from dissolving in water; otherwise, stock will become cloudy and unpleasing to the eye.
sen.cmt: 「一度茹でて」：文字どおりに"boil........once"と訳出しましたが、"boil........beforehand"の方が的確ではないかと思います。
sen.e: When using raw animal food such as fish, shellfish and chicken, it is necessary to boil it without fail to solidify water-soluble protein and thereby to prevent it from dissolving in water; otherwise, the stock will become cloudy and unpleasing to the eye.

When using raw animal food such as fish, shellfish and chicken, it is necessary to boil it without fail to solidify water-soluble protein and thereby to prevent it from dissolving in water; otherwise, the stock will become cloudy and unpleasing to the eye.

sen.j: 鯛
sen.e: Sea bream

sen.j: 鮭
sen.e: Salmon

sen.j: 白子
sen.e: Soft roe

sen.j: 海老
sen.e: Shrimp

sen.j: ハマグリ
sen.e: Asiatic hard shelled clam

sen.j: バカガイ
sen.e: Surf clam

sen.j: 烏賊
sen.e: Squid
Squid

sen.j: 鮑
sen.e: Awabi (abalone)
Awabi (abalone)

sen.j: 蟹
sen.e: Crab
Crab

sen.j: 鶏肉
sen.e: Chicken
Chicken

sen.j: 豆腐
sen.e: Tofu (bean curd)
Tofu (bean curd)

sen.j: ゆば
sen.e: Dried bean curds
Dried bean curds

sen.j: 素麺
sen.e: Thin noodles
Thin noodles

sen.j: シラウオ
sen.e: Whitebait
Whitebait
Whitebait

sen.j: サヨリ（さより）
sen.e: Halfbeak
Halfbeak
Halfbeak

sen.j: ウナギの肝 - 特に肝吸いと呼ばれる。
sen.e: Eel liver: Clear soup with eel liver is specifically called 'kimosui'.
Eel liver: Clear soup with eel liver is specifically called 'kimosui'.
Eel liver: Clear soup with eel liver is specifically called 'kimosui'.

sen.j: 鱧
sen.e: Sea eel
Sea eel
Sea eel

sen.j: 山芋
sen.e: Yam
Yam
Yam

sen.j: はんぺん
sen.e: Hanpen (a cake of ground fish combined with starch and steamed)
Hanpen (a cake of ground fish combined with starch and steamed)
Hanpen (a cake of ground fish combined with starch and steamed)

sen.j: 麩
sen.e: Fu (breadlike pieces of wheat gluten)
Fu (breadlike pieces of wheat gluten)
Fu (breadlike pieces of wheat gluten)

sen.j: 卵豆腐
sen.e: Steamed egg custard
Steamed egg custard
Steamed egg custard

sen.j: 椀種を引き立て、鮮やかな色彩を添えるものである。
sen.e: Tsuma makes wandane look better and lends a touch of bright color.
Tsuma makes wandane look better and lends a touch of bright color.
Tsuma makes wandane look better and lends a touch of bright color.

sen.j: 汁を濁さず、口当たりのよいものを選ぶ。
sen.e: Select a food material with a pleasant mouth-feel that does not make stock cloudy.
Select a food material with a pleasant mouth-feel that does not make the stock cloudy.
Select a food material with a pleasant mouth-feel that does not make the stock cloudy.

sen.j: 独活 - 短冊切りやねじり独活にして使う。
sen.e: Udo salad: Udo salad cut into rectangles or shaped into a twist may be used.
Udo salad: Udo salad cut into rectangles or shaped into a twist may be used.
Udo salad: Udo salad cut into rectangles or shaped into a twist may be used.

sen.j: ミツバ - 軸を結ぶ。
sen.e: Mitsuba (Japanese honewort): Mitsuba with its stems tied into a bundle may be used.
Mitsuba (Japanese honewort): Mitsuba with its stems tied into a bundle may be used.
Mitsuba (Japanese honewort): Mitsuba with its stems tied into a bundle may be used.

sen.j: ナメコ - さっと煮て余計なぬめりを取る。
sen.e: Nameko mushroom: Nameko mushroom may beforehand parboiled for the removal of slime may be used.
Nameko mushroom: Nameko mushroom may be parboiled, beforehand, for the removal of slime..
Nameko mushroom: Nameko mushroom may be parboiled, beforehand, for the removal of slime.

sen.j: ジュンサイ - 一度煮ておく。
sen.e: Water shield: Water shield beforehand given a preparatory boil may be used.
Water shield: Water shield given a preparatory boil may be used.
Water shield: Water shield given a preparatory boil may be used.

sen.j: 小松菜 - 塩茹でしてきる。
sen.e: Brassica Rapa (a kind of Chinese cabbage): Brassica Rapa cut after being boiled in salty water may be used.
Brassica Rapa (a kind of Chinese cabbage): Brassica Rapa cut after being boiled in salty water may be used.
Brassica Rapa (a kind of Chinese cabbage): Brassica Rapa cut after being boiled in salty water may be used.
sen.cmt: スペース削除括弧を半角に

sen.j: 大根 - 短冊切りで使う。
sen.e: Daikon (Japanese radish): Daikon cut into rectangles may be used.
Daikon (Japanese radish): Daikon cut into rectangles may be used.
Daikon (Japanese radish): Daikon cut into rectangles may be used.

sen.j: 水前寺のり - 水で戻して使う
sen.e: Suizenjinori (freshwater blue-green alga whose scientific name is Aphanothece sacrum): Suizenjinori beforehand soaked in water may be used.)
Suizenjinori (freshwater blue-green alga whose scientific name is Aphanothece sacrum): Suizenjinori soaked in water may be used.
Suizenjinori (freshwater blue-green alga whose scientific name is Aphanothece sacrum): Suizenjinori soaked in water may be used.

sen.j: シイタケ - 茹でて使う。
sen.e: Shiitake mushroom: Shiitake mushroom beforehand boiled may be used.
Shiitake mushroom: Shiitake mushroom boiled beforehand may be used.
Shiitake mushroom: Shiitake mushroom boiled beforehand may be used.

sen.j: ワカメ - 戻して使う。
sen.e: Wakame seaweed: Wakame seaweed beforehand soaked in water may be used.
Wakame seaweed: Wakame seaweed soaked in water beforehand may be used.
Wakame seaweed: Wakame seaweed soaked in water beforehand may be used.

sen.j: 香りのあるものを使う。
sen.e: A fragrant food material is used as suikuchi.
A fragrant food material is used as suikuchi.
A fragrant food material is used as suikuchi.

sen.j: すぐに蓋をしないと香りがとんでしまう。
sen.e: Suikuchi should be added to suiji immediately before the lid is put on a bowl so that its fragrance will not fade.
sen.cmt: 原文の語句だけでは的確に状況を説明できないので、下記のように読み替えました。香りがとばないよう、椀に蓋をする直前に吸い口を吸い地に添加する。
sen.e: Suikuchi should be added to suiji immediately before the lid is put on a bowl so that its fragrance will not fade.
Suikuchi should be added to suiji immediately before the lid is put on a bowl so that its fragrance will not fade.

sen.j: 柚子 - 表皮を削って使う。
sen.e: Yuzu (aromatic citron): Grated rind of yuzu may be used.
Yuzu (aromatic citron): Grated rind of yuzu may be used.
Yuzu (aromatic citron): Grated rind of yuzu may be used.

sen.j: 木の芽（山椒の若葉） - 1枚浮かべる。
sen.e: Young leaf of the Japanese pepper tree: One leaf may be floated on suiji in a bowl.
Young leaf of the Japanese pepper tree: One leaf may be floated on suiji in a bowl.
Young leaf of the Japanese pepper tree: One leaf may be floated on suiji in a bowl.

sen.j: 山葵 - 少しだけ擂って入れる。
sen.e: Wasabi (Japanese horseradish): A touch of grated wasabi may be added to suiji in a bowl.
Wasabi (Japanese horseradish): A touch of grated wasabi may be added to suiji in a bowl.
Wasabi (Japanese horseradish): A touch of grated wasabi may be added to suiji in a bowl.

sen.j: 生姜 - 針生姜を使うときと絞り汁を使うときがある。
sen.e: Ginger: Either thinly sliced ginger or ginger juice may be used according to circumstances.
Ginger: Either thinly sliced ginger or ginger juice may be used according to circumstances.
Ginger: Either thinly sliced ginger or ginger juice may be used according to circumstances.

sen.j: 茗荷 - 輪切りにして、水にさらしてから使う。
sen.e: Mioga ginger: Mioga ginger beforehand cut in round slices and soaked in water may be used.
Mioga ginger: Mioga ginger cut in round slices and soaked in water beforehand may be used.
Mioga ginger: Mioga ginger cut in round slices and soaked in water beforehand may be used.

sen.j: 柚子胡椒 - 少しだけ取って入れる。
sen.e: Yuzu kosho (a spicy, hot Japanese condiment made from yuzu rind, chili and salt): A touch of Yuzu Kosho may be added to suiji in a bowl.
sen.cmt: 「取って」：何から取り出すのかが明記されておらず、また、文脈上重要な意味を持たないので、訳出しませんでした。
sen.e: Yuzu kosho (a spicy, hot Japanese condiment made from yuzu rind, chili, and salt): A touch of Yuzu Kosho may be added to suiji in a bowl.
Yuzu kosho (a spicy, hot Japanese condiment made from yuzu rind, chili, and salt): A touch of Yuzu Kosho may be added to suiji in a bowl.

sen.j: 七味唐辛子 - 少しだけ入れる。
sen.e: Shichimi togarashi (a mixture of red cayenne pepper and other aromatic spices): A touch of shichimi togarashi may be added to suiji in a bowl.
Shichimi togarashi (a mixture of red cayenne pepper and other aromatic spices): A touch of shichimi togarashi may be added to suiji in a bowl.
Shichimi togarashi (a mixture of red cayenne pepper and other aromatic spices): A touch of shichimi togarashi may be added to suiji in a bowl.

sen.j: 出汁に醤油や塩などを加えて色付け・香り付けした汁を「吸い地（すいじ）」という。
sen.e: Soup stock colored and flavored with soy sauce, salt and other seasoning is called 'suiji'.
sen.cmt: 原文に忠実に訳出すると左記のようになりますが、下記の方が、表題からの流れが自然ではないかと思います。'Suiji' refers to soup stock colored and flavored with soy sauce, salt and other seasonings.
sen.e: Soup stock colored and flavored with soy sauce, salt, and other seasoning is called 'suiji'.
Soup stock colored and flavored with soy sauce, salt, and other seasoning is called 'suiji.'

sen.j: 「吸い地」はどのような具材にも合うという意味で「吸い地八方（すいじはっぽう）」ともいう（ただし、「吸い地八方」は椀種に予め味付けするために多少濃く味付けしたものを指すこともある）。
sen.e: Suiji is also called 'suiji happo' (literally, all-purpose soup stock) in that its taste matches well with any solid ingredient; however, 'suiji happo' refers in some cases to soup stock seasoned somewhat strongly that is used to beforehand season wandane.

Suiji is also called 'suiji happo' (literally, all-purpose soup stock) in that its taste matches well with any solid ingredient; however, 'suiji happo' refers in some cases to soup stock seasoned somewhat strongly that is used to season wandane.

Suiji is also called 'suiji happo' (literally, all-purpose soup stock) in that its taste matches well with any solid ingredient; however, 'suiji happo' refers in some cases to soup stock seasoned somewhat strongly that is used to season wandane.
